metadata.title: CVE-2014-3137 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Bottle 0.10.x before 0.10.12, 0.11.x before 0.11.7, and 0.12.x before0.12.6 does not properly limit content types, which allows remote attackersto bypass intended access restrictions via an accepted Content-Typefollowed by a ; (semi-colon) and a Content-Type that would not be accepted,as demonstrated in YouCompleteMe to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-bottle - 0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-bottle - 0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-bottle package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
